text: Deep brown with tan head. Aroma is chocolate. Flavor is chocoffee and roast malt. Light bodied and clean. nice beer loaded with flavor and body for low abv
On tap. Dark brown in color with small creamy tan head. Light caramel malt aroma. Somewhat sweet with roasted malt character. Light-to-medium bodied with roasty finish. Pretty good.

Can.
Clear deep garnet with a small tan head..
The aroma has some roast malts that are almost smoky, dark caramel.
The flavor has a rich nutty roast malt character. Slightly bitter. Flavorful mild.
Aroma is roasted dark malts. Types of malts, water, hope, yeast and water are listed on the can. Color is dark brown with a tan head. Taste slightly bitter with a pale malt influence. Not watery.
Rich chocolate and roast aroma. Mahogany with a creamy beige head. Tart roasted grain, brown malt, caramel. Clean and round. Medium body with soft carbonation.
This is a pretty tasty mild. Nice light roasty flavored, dry, slightly bitter finish. Good.
Pretty much no smell, taste is actually like kalamata olives to me...not john... interesting...light salt...but thats about it
Quite storng and kinteresting. Good US mild and the testure is quite similar too. Easy to enjoy.

Havent had too many milds to gauge, but Id say this is mix of a brown ale and ESB. Darker than I expected, with heavier and flavor and feel than I expected for only 4.4%. The typical caramel/chocolate malts, some sweet toffee...decent hop blend to give that bitter to balance out. This is one that I would sample again.

​On tap @ First Magnitude. Deep chestnut colored beer with some khaki foam. Has a bit of toasted coconut as well as lots of roast, coffee, and bready malt. Some nice toasted grains and bread. Light earthy quality and bitterness to go with the (understated) sweetness of the beer. Nice balance of malt and hop character and very easy to drink. Quite enjoyable.
On tap at the brewery. An interesting take on the style. Im getting lots of coffee and chocolate. A dry, roasted finish like chewing on coffee grounds.
Pretty decent mild brown. Dark brown. Nutty, chocolate, toasty. Light body, easy drinkin dark. Just fine.
4/25/15. On tap at the brewery. Brown pour with a small tan head. Nice biscuit aroma, toffee, light chocolate and nuttiness, toast. Mild flavor, biscuit, toast, light chocolate and caramel. Not bad.

Nice rendition of the style with plenty of flavor, despite being very light. FM seems to do these styles very well. Will be interesting to see how they progress as they (maybe) ramp things up to bigger beers. But this, and their ESB, are excellent within style and Im happy to have them.
Pours dark...slight tannish head...nose of coffee and caramel...tastes of roasted malts nice bitterness from the hops. Very flavorful for low ABV brew.

On tap at the brewery.
Clear but very dark brown with a modest head that soon reduces to a durable ring and partial top coat. Ruby highlights. 

Aroma: mild and malty, with a darker roast than expected. 
Flavor: follows the aroma. Mildly bitter. Dark and flavorful for style.
Brass tap gainesville. Really a solid mild, chocolatey, roasty, a nice touch of bitterness, some coffee notes. Remarkably tasty and drinkable.

Tallahassee, Fl - Florida Beer Invitational - Proof Brewing - on tap. Dark brown light off-white head. Interesting aroma with some brown sugar, strong spices, black coffee notes. Flavor has some coffee notes, a touch of brown sugar, some bittersweet chocolate. Smooth mouthfeel.

Cola brown, clear. Small ivory/khaki head. Pleasant, malty (almost spicy) aroma. Chalky mouthfeel. Cocoa, toasty, roasted, lightly sweet. Bittersweet chocolate powder finish. Lightish body.   Florida Tap Invitational, Proof.  Upon reconsideratation, one of my favorite beers of the night. With LuckyDog, PorterPounder.
Outstanding. Mild is not a common style and it should be. Very drinkable. Lightly hopped. Moderate roasted flavor.

Draft. Nose of cocoa and chocolate with a light coffe note. Taste is like a powdered chocolate with a bit if chalkiness or dryness to it. A wonderful silky mouthfeel, very silky smooth and full bodied. My fave so far
